text:
Here's the output from my installation on Solaris Sparc 8.

# ./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache2

checking for working mkdir -p... yes
checking build system type... sparc-sun-solaris2.8

# make
make: syntax error at line 1: `(' unexpected
creator: lee8858@sbcglobal.net
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Please review your config.log; find the section which describes these tests;

checking for non-GNU ld... no
configure: error: no acceptable ld found in $PATH
configure failed for srclib/apr

and don't paste 1,000 lines of info into a comment, but add as a text attachment.

No response to information request; closing.

To the OP: you need to install developer tools, either Sun's or GNU.  Or else install apache as a binary package.  But this is not an appropriate forum to discuss that.
creator: nick@webthing.com
